Detailed Description

A subclass of Shader that draws a sweep gradient around a center point. 

 //Example: draw a circle with sweep gradient on canvas.
 //create colors/positions array and also the base class - Shader
     Shader *shader;
     gaia::base::Array<uint32_t> colorArray(3);
     gaia::base::Array<float> posArray(3);
 // assign colors to colorArray
     colorArray[0] = Color::RED; colorArray[1] = Color::GREEN; colorArray[2] = Color::BLUE;
 // assign positions to posArray
     posArray[0] = 0.2; posArray[1] = 0.3; posArray[2] = 0.5;
 
 //test for SweepGradient
     shader = new SweepGradient(50.0f, 150.0f, colorArray, posArray);
 //set sweep gradient as Shader for paint.
     paint.setShader(shader);
 //draw circle on canvas
     canvas->drawCircle(50.0f, 150.0f, 50.0f, paint);

Definition at line 38 of file SweepGradient.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

gaia::graphics::SweepGradient::SweepGradient ( float  cx,
float  cy,
const gaia::base::Array< uint32_t > &  colors,
const gaia::base::Array< float > &  positions 
)

A subclass of Shader that draws a sweep gradient around a center point.

Parameters:
cxThe x-coordinate of the center
cyThe y-coordinate of the center
colorsThe colors to be distributed between around the center. There must be at least 2 colors in the array.
positionsMay be NULL. The relative position of each corresponding color in the colors array, beginning with 0 and ending with 1.0. If the values are not monotonic, the drawing may produce unexpected results. If positions is NULL, then the colors are automatically spaced evenly.
gaia::graphics::SweepGradient::SweepGradient ( float  cx,
float  cy,
uint32_t  color0,
uint32_t  color1 
)

A subclass of Shader that draws a sweep gradient around a center point.

Parameters:
cxThe x-coordinate of the center
cyThe y-coordinate of the center
color0The color to use at the start of the sweep
color1The color to use at the end of the sweep
